name: Rocking Lounger "Relaxer 2" by Verner Panton for Rosenthal, 1974

specifications.rawSpecificationsHTML: Among Verner Panton's many groundbreaking designs, the Relaxer 2 stands as a timeless icon of 1970s furniture design. Originally created for Philip Rosenthal’s "Rosenthal studio-line" and produced in limited quantities, this floor-level rocking lounger embodies the innovative spirit of the era. Crafted from solid beech with a three-part finger-jointed construction and a lacquered surface, the chair offers both a visually striking and incredibly functional piece of design. The seat and backrest feature foam padding covered in white fabric adorned with bold black stripes, providing a striking contrast while ensuring comfort and durability. The Relaxer 2 remains in its original condition, maintaining the same comfort and charm it offered when first designed. It is marked with the manufacturer's label, verifying its authenticity and rarity. The 1970s was a decade marked by experimentation and playful design, with designers like Verner Panton embracing new materials and forms. This chair, with its minimalist yet striking design, epitomizes the era's love for colorful, dynamic furniture that merges form and function. As a highly sought-after collector's item, the Relaxer 2 is not only a piece of functional seating but also a statement of design history.
